page.title: 16BUSSES IN THE DISTRICT
page.content: Until 1965 there was a railway station in Otley. This was closed and the land where the station was is now part of the Otley by-pass. The only public transport now is the bus service. There is a very good service to Leeds and Ilkley, and to Bradford and Harrogate, and there are local busses to Weston Estate and to the villages around Otley. All these bus services are run by the National Bus Company West Yorkshire branch. The Leeds, Ilkley, Bradford and Harrogate routes are usually double deck busses, and the others are single deck. Otley has a coach company as well. It is called Beecroft's, and the garage is at the side of the main road to Menston. They run some of the school services, and do private hire as well.
